column1: Words
寂しい means lonely, sad, or desolate. For example, あなたがいなくて寂しいです (I miss you when you are not here) or 寂しいと感じることはありませんか (Don’t you ever feel lonely?).
容易い means easy, simple, or facile. For example, この問題は容易いです (This problem is easy) or 容易いことではありません (It is not a simple matter).
四角い means square or rectangular. For example, 四角いテーブル (a square table) or 四角い顔 (a rectangular face).
涼しい means cool, refreshing, or pleasant. For example, 涼しい風が吹いている (A cool breeze is blowing) or 涼しい飲み物が欲しい (I want a refreshing drink).
詳しい means detailed, specific, or well-informed. For example, 詳しい説明をしてください (Please give me a detailed explanation) or 彼は歴史に詳しいです (He is well-informed about history).
尊い means precious, valuable, or noble. For example, 尊い命を失った (He lost his precious life) or 尊い教えを守る (To follow the noble teachings).
ぎこちない means awkward, clumsy, or stiff. For example, ぎこちない挨拶をした (He made an awkward greeting) or ぎこちない動きをする (To move clumsily).
心細い means helpless, anxious, or insecure. For example, 心細い思いをする (To feel helpless) or 心細くなるような話をしないでください (Please don’t say things that make me feel insecure).
素早い means quick, fast, or agile. For example, 素早く走る (To run quickly) or 素早く反応する (To react fast).
上手い means skillful, clever, or delicious. For example, 上手に描く (To draw skillfully) or 上手く話す (To speak cleverly) or 上手く料理する (To cook deliciously).
小高い means slightly elevated, hilly, or rising. For example, 小高い山に登る (To climb a slightly elevated mountain) or 小高い丘から眺める (To look from a hilly hill).
仕方無い means inevitable, unavoidable, or helpless. For example, 仕方無いことだから諦める (To give up because it is inevitable) or 仕方無く参加する (To participate reluctantly).
涼しい means cool, refreshing, or pleasant. For example, 涼しい風が吹いている (A cool breeze is blowing) or 涼しい飲み物が欲しい (I want a refreshing drink).
厚い means thick, deep, or heavy. For example, 厚い本を読む (To read a thick book) or 厚い雪が積もっている (There is deep snow piled up) or 厚いメイクをする (To put on heavy makeup).

下らない means worthless, trivial, or nonsense. For example, 下らない話をする (To talk about worthless things) or 下らないことに怒らないで (Don’t get angry about trivial things) or 下らないものは見ないでください (Please don’t watch nonsense things).
辛抱強い means patient, persevering, or enduring. For example, 辛抱強く待つ (To wait patiently) or 辛抱強く続ける (To continue perseveringly) or 辛抱強く耐える (To endure enduringly).
用心深い means cautious, careful, or prudent. For example, 用心深く歩く (To walk cautiously) or 用心深く話す (To speak carefully) or 用心深く考える (To think prudently).
緩い means loose, slack, or lenient. For example, 緩いベルトを締める (To tighten a loose belt) or 緩い糸を引っ張る (To pull a slack thread) or 緩い規則を守る (To follow lenient rules).
冷たい means cold, cool, or unfriendly. For example, 冷たい水を飲む (To drink cold water) or 冷たい空気を感じる (To feel cool air) or 冷たい態度をとる (To take an unfriendly attitude).
酷い means terrible, awful, or cruel. For example, 酷い目にあう (To have a terrible experience) or 酷い言葉を言う (To say awful words) or 酷い仕打ちをする (To do cruel treatment).
難しい means difficult, hard, or complicated. For example, 難しい問題を解く (To solve a difficult problem) or 難しい言葉を覚える (To remember hard words) or 難しい状況に陥る (To fall into a complicated situation).
優しい means kind, gentle, or nice. For example, 優しい人に出会う (To meet a kind person) or 優しい声で話す (To speak with a gentle voice) or 優しい気持ちになる (To feel nice).
深い means deep, profound, or intense. For example, 深い海に潜る (To dive into the deep sea) or 深い考えにふける (To indulge in profound thoughts) or 深い愛情を抱く (To hold intense affection).
寒い means cold, chilly, or unpleasant. For example, 寒い日に外出する (To go out on a cold day) or 寒い目で見られる (To be looked at with chilly eyes) or 寒い冗談を言う (To say an unpleasant joke).

思いがけない means unexpected, surprising, or unforeseen. For example, 思いがけないプレゼントをもらう (To receive an unexpected gift) or 思いがけない出来事に驚く (To be surprised by a surprising event) or 思いがけない事態に対処する (To deal with an unforeseen situation).
うざい means annoying, irritating, or bothersome. For example, うざい音を止めて (Stop the annoying noise) or うざい人に会いたくない (I don’t want to meet irritating people) or うざいことを言わないで (Don’t say bothersome things).
夥しい means numerous, plentiful, or abundant. For example, 夥しい本を持っている (To have numerous books) or 夥しい食べ物を用意する (To prepare plentiful food) or 夥しい資源を利用する (To use abundant resources).
怠い means lazy, drowsy, or sluggish. For example, 怠い朝を過ごす (To spend a lazy morning) or 怠い目をこする (To rub drowsy eyes) or 怠い動きをする (To make sluggish movements).
酸っぱい means sour, acidic, or tart. For example, 酸っぱいレモンを食べる (To eat a sour lemon) or 酸っぱい匂いがする (To smell an acidic odor) or 酸っぱい味がする (To taste tart).
数え切れない means countless, innumerable, or incalculable. For example, 数え切れない星を見る (To see countless stars) or 数え切れない人が集まる (To gather innumerable people) or 数え切れない恩がある (To have incalculable favors).
清々しい means refreshing, invigorating, or exhilarating. For example, 清々しい風を感じる (To feel a refreshing breeze) or 清々しい気分になる (To become invigorated) or 清々しい笑顔を見せる (To show an exhilarating smile).
痛い means painful, hurtful, or sore. For example, 痛い傷を負う (To suffer a painful wound) or 痛い言葉を言われる (To be told hurtful words) or 痛い筋肉をほぐす (To loosen sore muscles).
短い means short, brief, or concise. For example, 短い髪を切る (To cut short hair) or 短い時間で済ます (To finish in a brief time) or 短い文章を書く (To write a concise sentence).
青白い means pale, ashen, or bluish-white. For example, 青白い顔色をする (To have a pale complexion) or 青白い光を放つ (To emit an ashen light) or 青白い花を咲かせる (To bloom bluish-white flowers).
つまんない means boring, dull, or uninteresting. For example, つまんない本を読む (To read a boring book) or つまんない話を聞く (To listen to a dull story) or つまんない人生を送る (To lead an uninteresting life).
粘り強い means tenacious, persistent, or resilient. For example, 粘り強い交渉をする (To do tenacious negotiations) or 粘り強い努力を続ける (To continue persistent efforts) or 粘り強い精神を持つ (To have a resilient spirit).
不味い means bad-tasting, unpalatable, or nasty. For example, 不味い料理を食べる (To eat a bad-tasting dish) or 不味い水を飲む (To drink unpalatable water) or 不味い冗談を言う (To tell a nasty joke).
虚しい means empty, vain, or futile. For example, 虚しい気持ちになる (To feel empty) or 虚しい栄誉を得る (To gain vain honor) or 虚しい努力をする (To make futile efforts).
醜い means ugly, hideous, or disgusting. For example, 醜い顔をする (To make an ugly face) or 醜い犯罪を犯す (To commit a hideous crime) or 醜い行為を嫌う (To detest disgusting acts).
懐かしい means nostalgic, reminiscent, or dear. For example, 懐かしい思い出を語る (To talk about nostalgic memories) or 懐かしい場所に行く (To go to a reminiscent place) or 懐かしい人に会う (To meet a dear person).
美しい means beautiful, lovely, or gorgeous. For example, 美しい景色を見る (To see a beautiful scenery) or 美しい歌声を聞く (To hear a lovely singing voice) or 美しいドレスを着る (To wear a gorgeous dress).
正しい means correct, right, or proper. For example, 正しい答えを選ぶ (To choose the correct answer) or 正しい判断をする (To make the right judgment) or 正しい態度をとる (To adopt a proper attitude).
勇ましい means brave, gallant, or valiant. For example, 勇ましい戦士になる (To become a brave warrior) or 勇ましい行動をとる (To take a gallant action) or 勇ましい姿を見せる (To show a valiant figure).
遠い means far, distant, or remote. For example, 遠い国に行く (To go to a far country) or 遠い親戚に会う (To meet a distant relative) or 遠い星を眺める (To gaze at a remote star).
鈍い means dull, slow, or blunt. For example, 鈍いナイフで切る (To cut with a dull knife) or 鈍い反応をする (To make a slow response) or 鈍い痛みを感じる (To feel a blunt pain).
めでたい means auspicious, happy, or celebratory. For example, めでたい日を祝う (To celebrate an auspicious day) or めでたいニュースを聞く (To hear a happy news) or めでたい席に招かれる (To be invited to a celebratory seat).
誇らしい means proud, honorable, or glorious. For example, 誇らしい成績を収める (To achieve a proud result) or 誇らしい歴史を持つ (To have an honorable history) or 誇らしい勝利を得る (To gain a glorious victory).
違いない means certain, sure, or no doubt. For example, 彼は成功する違いない (He will succeed for certain) or これは本物のダイヤモンド違いない (This is a real diamond for sure) or 彼女は幸せだ違いない (She is happy no doubt).
少ない means few, little, or scarce. For example, 少ない時間で仕事を終わらせる (To finish work in a few time) or 少ないお金で暮らす (To live on little money) or 少ない水で済ます (To make do with scarce water).
余儀ない means inevitable, unavoidable, or compelled. For example, 余儀なく退場する (To be inevitably dismissed) or 余儀なく逃げる (To be unavoidably run away) or 余儀なく従う (To be compelled to obey).
訝しい means doubtful, suspicious, or questionable. For example, 訝しい話を聞く (To hear a doubtful story) or 訝しい人物に出会う (To encounter a suspicious person) or 訝しい行動をする (To do a questionable action).
易しい means easy, simple, or facile. For example, 易しい問題を解く (To solve an easy problem) or 易しい言葉で説明する (To explain in simple words) or 易しい仕事をする (To do a facile job).
限り無い means endless, unlimited, or eternal. For example, 限り無い可能性を持つ (To have an endless potential) or 限り無い自由を求める (To seek an unlimited freedom) or 限り無い愛を誓う (To vow an eternal love).
強い means strong, powerful, or intense. For example, 強い力を持つ (To have a strong force) or 強い影響を与える (To give a powerful influence) or 強い感情を抱く (To harbor an intense emotion).
逞しい means sturdy, robust, or tough. For example, 逞しい体を作る (To build a sturdy body) or 逞しい精神力を持つ (To have a robust mental strength) or 逞しい生き方をする (To live a tough life).
怪しい means suspicious, dubious, or fishy. For example, 怪しい音がする (To hear a suspicious sound) or 怪しい人に話しかけられる (To be talked to by a dubious person) or 怪しい取引をする (To do a fishy deal).
憎い means hateful, detestable, or abominable. For example, 憎い敵を倒す (To defeat a hateful enemy) or 憎い行為をする (To do a detestable act) or 憎い虫を殺す (To kill an abominable bug).
細かい means small, fine, or detailed. For example, 細かい字を書く (To write a small letter) or 細かい粉にする (To make a fine powder) or 細かい点を確認する (To check the detailed points).
忙しい means busy, occupied, or hectic. For example, 忙しい一日を過ごす (To spend a busy day) or 忙しい仕事に追われる (To be chased by an occupied work) or 忙しいスケジュールをこなす (To handle a hectic schedule).
弱い means weak, feeble, or frail. For example, 弱い力しか出せない (To only exert a weak force) or 弱い声で話す (To speak in a feeble voice) or 弱い体質を持つ (To have a frail constitution).
羨ましい means enviable, jealous, or covetous. For example, 羨ましい旅行をする (To do an enviable trip) or 羨ましい人生を送る (To lead a jealous life) or 羨ましい物を持つ (To have a covetous thing).
喧しい means noisy, loud, or boisterous. For example, 喧しい音楽を聞く (To listen to noisy music) or 喧しい声で叫ぶ (To shout in a loud voice) or 喧しい子供たちを見る (To see boisterous children).
恥ずかしい means embarrassing, shameful, or awkward. For example, 恥ずかしい失敗をする (To make an embarrassing mistake) or 恥ずかしい秘密を持つ (To have a shameful secret) or 恥ずかしい場面に遭う (To encounter an awkward situation).
諄い means tedious, repetitious, or long-winded. For example, 諄い話を聞く (To listen to a tedious story) or 諄い説明をする (To do a repetitious explanation) or 諄い文章を書く (To write a long-winded sentence).
心地良い means comfortable, pleasant, or cozy. For example, 心地良い空気を吸う (To breathe a comfortable air) or 心地良い音を聞く (To hear a pleasant sound) or 心地良い家に住む (To live in a cozy house).
可笑しい means funny, strange, or ridiculous. For example, 可笑しいジョークを言う (To tell a funny joke) or 可笑しい話を聞く (To hear a strange story) or 可笑しい要求をする (To make a ridiculous demand).
凄まじい means fierce, shattering, or tremendous. For example, 凄まじい戦闘に参加する (To participate in a fierce battle) or 凄まじい音がする (To make a shattering sound) or 凄まじい力を持つ (To have a tremendous power).
しつこい means persistent, annoying, or greasy. For example, しつこい売り込みを断る (To refuse a persistent sales pitch) or しつこい虫を追い払う (To drive away an annoying bug) or しつこい料理を食べる (To eat a greasy dish).
険しい means steep, grim, or harsh. For example, 険しい山道を登る (To climb a steep mountain path) or 険しい表情をする (To make a grim expression) or 険しい現実に直面する (To face a harsh reality).
親しい means close, familiar, or intimate. For example, 親しい友人と話す (To talk with a close friend) or 親しい言葉で呼ぶ (To call by a familiar name) or 親しい関係になる (To become intimate).
危ない means dangerous, risky, or unsafe. For example, 危ない場所に行く (To go to a dangerous place) or 危ない賭けをする (To make a risky bet) or 危ない運転をする (To do an unsafe driving).
大きい means big, large, or great. For example, 大きい家に住む (To live in a big house) or 大きい声で話す (To speak in a large voice) or 大きい影響を与える (To have a great influence).
軽い means light, easy, or frothy. For example, 軽い荷物を持つ (To carry a light luggage) or 軽い仕事をする (To do an easy job) or 軽い飲み物を飲む (To drink a frothy beverage).
果てしない means endless, eternal, or unending. For example, 果てしない空を見る (To see an endless sky) or 果てしない愛を誓う (To vow an eternal love) or 果てしない苦しみに耐える (To endure an unending pain).
暗い means dark, gloomy, or dull. For example, 暗い部屋に入る (To enter a dark room) or 暗い気分になる (To become gloomy) or 暗い色を着る (To wear a dull color).
